subtask.title: Review Theoretical Frameworks for AI Agents
subtask.objective: Identify existing theoretical models that explain the use cases, strengths, and constraints of AI agents in automation and decision-making.
subtask.scope: Explore literature on agent-based systems, reinforcement learning, and autonomous decision-making architectures.

verification.completion_summary: The research identified practical evaluation frameworks, observability techniques, multi-turn conversation management, and data analysis methods for AI agents. However, it lacks explicit coverage of theoretical models addressing use cases, strengths, and constraints of AI agents in automation/decision-making.

missing_aspects: Explicit theoretical models explaining use cases

missing_requirements: Theoretical frameworks for AI agent behavior
Direct comparison of agent-based systems vs. other models
Comprehensive coverage of reinforcement learning literature
